body.head.byline: By JENNIFER MEDINA; Compiled by John Sullivan

abstract.p: William B White, former head of New Haven Police Dept's narcotics division, is indicted on charges that include theft, bribery and fraud (S)

block.p: The former head of the New Haven Police Department's narcotics division was indicted yesterday on charges including theft, bribery and fraud, federal prosecutors said. The former lieutenant, William B. White, 63, and three bail bondsmen were arrested last month in a federal sting operation. Prosecutors said Mr. White routinely received money from the three men: Robert Jacobs, 79, who runs a local bail bonds service, and his two sons, Paul, 48, and Philip, 47. According to prosecutors, the bondsmen would bribe Mr. White to track down criminals who had posted bail bonds but failed to appear; their failure to appear would have caused the bondsmen to lose money.
